name: Titanium.UI.Android.CardView
summary: CardView provides a layout container with rounded corners and a shadow indicating the view is elevated.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.summary: Background color for CardView as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: Each corner is rounded using an arc of a circle. Values for each corner can be specified. For example, '20px 20px' will set both left and right corners to 20px. Specifying '20px 20px 20px 20px' will set top-left, top-right, bottom-right and bottom-left corners in that order.

properties.name: elevation
properties.description:
The elevation of a view determines the appearance of its shadow. Higher elevations produce larger and softer shadows.

Note: The elevation property only works on Titanium.UI.View objects. Many Android components have a default elevation that cannot be modified. For more information, see Google design guidelines: Elevation and shadows.

properties.name: padding
properties.summary: Inner padding between the edges of the Card and children of the CardView.

properties.name: paddingBottom
properties.summary: Inner padding between the bottom edge of the Card and children of the CardView.

properties.name: paddingLeft
properties.summary: Inner padding between the left edge of the Card and children of the CardView.

properties.name: paddingRight
properties.summary: Inner padding between the right edge of the Card and children of the CardView.

properties.name: paddingTop
properties.summary: Inner padding between the top edge of the Card and children of the CardView.

properties.name: preventCornerOverlap
properties.summary: Add padding to CardView on API level 20 and before to prevent intersections between the Card content and rounded corners.

properties.name: useCompatPadding
properties.summary: Add padding on API level 21 and above to have the same measurements with previous versions.
